title: MS Analytics & Graduate Certificate Virtual Information Session
description:
Montclair's  MS in Business Analytics  equips students with the skills to analyze complex data, solve business challenges, and drive decision-making across industries like finance, healthcare, marketing, and technology. Whether you're looking to advance in your current role or pivot into analytics, this is your opportunity to gain a competitive edge. 
 Join us for a virtual information session April 29 at 9:30 AM (EST)  to learn how our program prepares graduates to tackle complex business challenges and lead data-driven initiatives at globally recognized companies.

title: Annotated Bibliographies
description:
Learn about the different types of annotated bibliographies, what information is included in each type, and how to format your annotated bibliography. 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Citing Sources by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14374621

title: CPT Workshop - International Students (F-1 Visa Holders) Only
description: For students who are planning to apply for CPT for the summer or fall 2025 semesters. Learn more about Curricular Practical Training (CPT) for F-1 students. Any student planning to apply for CPT is REQUIRED to attend a workshop before they can apply. This workshop is for CURRENT students ONLY - any other attendees will be removed.

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: Graduate Counseling Certificates Virtual Information Session
description:
Looking to expand your expertise and open new career opportunities in counseling? Our career-focused certificate programs can help you grow professionally and make a greater impact in the field of mental health and wellness.  Our academic preparation follows guidelines established by state licensure and certification boards, ensuring you have the most up-to-date training to perform on the job. During our  upcoming virtual information session on April 29 at 12:30 PM , you will learn about the following certificates we offer: 
 
 
 
   
 
 
 The courses in the  Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC) Certificate  program fulfill the educational requirements set by the Addiction Professionals Certification Board of New Jersey (APCBNJ) for CADC eligibility.   
 
 
 The  Student Assistance Coordinator  program offers students the opportunity to take a sequence of post-master’s courses required by the New Jersey Department of Education for individuals who wish to become Student Assistance Coordinators in K-12 schools. 
 
 
 The  School Counselor (Post-Master’s Certification)  program meets the highest professional standards according to the New Jersey Department of Education and the national accrediting body, CACREP. This certification will provide the additional credit hours necessary to obtain a NJ School Counselor Certification.   
 
 
 The  Advanced Counseling Certificate  program is designed to fulfill state-level and national standards for Licensed Professional Counselors. This program meets the highest professional standards according to CACREP, The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC), and the NJ Board of Marriage and Family Therapists.

title: Picnic Paint and Sip
location: The Student Center Quad/Ballroom C (Rain Location)
description: Unwind from finals with the Office of Student Belonging for a Picnic Paint and Sip! Enjoy a relaxing day outdoors with friends. All students are welcome!

title: Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions - One day, Three Locations
location: Student Center Quad 1, School of Communication Lobby Staircase, & Memorial Auditorium Courtyard
description:
🎨✨ You’re invited to the Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions! 
   
 Presented by the Department of Art & Design, this one-day, three-location event features powerful work from students in collaboration with Professors Jess Blaustein, Simone Couto, and Genevieve Lowe. 
   
 🗓️  Tuesday, April 29, 2025 🕑  2:00–4:00 PM 📍  Three unique exhibitions across campus 
   
 🔻  SECTION 01: Awakening Visions 📍  Student Center Quad 1 Exploring identity, gender, desire, suffering, and transcendence through deeply personal and collective perspectives. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 02: Elevate 📍  School of Communication Lobby Staircase A reflection on growth, experimentation, and the evolving practice of becoming—artistically and individually. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 03: Labyrinths of Matter 📍  Memorial Auditorium Courtyard An immersive journey through materiality, emotion, and meaning—get lost and discover something within. 
   
 Come walk the campus, meet the artists, and experience a vibrant range of voices, visions, and mediums. 🎭🖼️🌀

title: Counseling MA Virtual Information Session (School Counseling & Student Affairs/Higher Education Concentrations)
description:
Prepare for roles where you can help students navigate challenges, grow, and succeed. Whether you're interested in guiding K-12 students as a school counselor or supporting college students in higher education, our Counseling programs offer the training and credentials to build a meaningful career. Join us for a virtual information session on April 29 at 4:00 PM (EST) . Our programs are designed to provide you with the knowledge, skills, and practical experience you need to become a successful counselor. This session will cover the following concentrations: 
 
 School Counseling 
 Student Affairs/Higher Education

During our  upcoming virtual information session on April 29 at 12:30 PM , you will learn about the following certificates we offer: 
 
 
 
   
 
 
 The courses in the  Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC) Certificate  program fulfill the educational requirements set by the Addiction Professionals Certification Board of New Jersey (APCBNJ) for CADC eligibility.   
 
 
 The  Student Assistance Coordinator  program offers students the opportunity to take a sequence of post-master’s courses required by the New Jersey Department of Education for individuals who wish to become Student Assistance Coordinators in K-12 schools. 
 
 
 The  School Counselor (Post-Master’s Certification)  program meets the highest professional standards according to the New Jersey Department of Education and the national accrediting body, CACREP. This certification will provide the additional credit hours necessary to obtain a NJ School Counselor Certification.   
 
 
 The  Advanced Counseling Certificate  program is designed to fulfill state-level and national standards for Licensed Professional Counselors. This program meets the highest professional standards according to CACREP, The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC), and the NJ Board of Marriage and Family Therapists.

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: Graduate Counseling Certificates Virtual Information Session
description:
Looking to expand your expertise and open new career opportunities in counseling? Our career-focused certificate programs can help you grow professionally and make a greater impact in the field of mental health and wellness.  Our academic preparation follows guidelines established by state licensure and certification boards, ensuring you have the most up-to-date training to perform on the job. During our  upcoming virtual information session on April 29 at 12:30 PM , you will learn about the following certificates we offer: 
 
 
 
   
 
 
 The courses in the  Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC) Certificate  program fulfill the educational requirements set by the Addiction Professionals Certification Board of New Jersey (APCBNJ) for CADC eligibility.   
 
 
 The  Student Assistance Coordinator  program offers students the opportunity to take a sequence of post-master’s courses required by the New Jersey Department of Education for individuals who wish to become Student Assistance Coordinators in K-12 schools. 
 
 
 The  School Counselor (Post-Master’s Certification)  program meets the highest professional standards according to the New Jersey Department of Education and the national accrediting body, CACREP. This certification will provide the additional credit hours necessary to obtain a NJ School Counselor Certification.   
 
 
 The  Advanced Counseling Certificate  program is designed to fulfill state-level and national standards for Licensed Professional Counselors. This program meets the highest professional standards according to CACREP, The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC), and the NJ Board of Marriage and Family Therapists.

title: Picnic Paint and Sip
location: The Student Center Quad/Ballroom C (Rain Location)
description: Unwind from finals with the Office of Student Belonging for a Picnic Paint and Sip! Enjoy a relaxing day outdoors with friends. All students are welcome!

title: Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions - One day, Three Locations
location: Student Center Quad 1, School of Communication Lobby Staircase, & Memorial Auditorium Courtyard
description:
🎨✨ You’re invited to the Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions! 
   
 Presented by the Department of Art & Design, this one-day, three-location event features powerful work from students in collaboration with Professors Jess Blaustein, Simone Couto, and Genevieve Lowe. 
   
 🗓️  Tuesday, April 29, 2025 🕑  2:00–4:00 PM 📍  Three unique exhibitions across campus 
   
 🔻  SECTION 01: Awakening Visions 📍  Student Center Quad 1 Exploring identity, gender, desire, suffering, and transcendence through deeply personal and collective perspectives. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 02: Elevate 📍  School of Communication Lobby Staircase A reflection on growth, experimentation, and the evolving practice of becoming—artistically and individually. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 03: Labyrinths of Matter 📍  Memorial Auditorium Courtyard An immersive journey through materiality, emotion, and meaning—get lost and discover something within. 
   
 Come walk the campus, meet the artists, and experience a vibrant range of voices, visions, and mediums. 🎭🖼️🌀

Our career-focused certificate programs can help you grow professionally and make a greater impact in the field of mental health and wellness.  Our academic preparation follows guidelines established by state licensure and certification boards, ensuring you have the most up-to-date training to perform on the job. During our  upcoming virtual information session on April 29 at 12:30 PM , you will learn about the following certificates we offer: 
 
 
 
   
 
 
 The courses in the  Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC) Certificate  program fulfill the educational requirements set by the Addiction Professionals Certification Board of New Jersey (APCBNJ) for CADC eligibility.   
 
 
 The  Student Assistance Coordinator  program offers students the opportunity to take a sequence of post-master’s courses required by the New Jersey Department of Education for individuals who wish to become Student Assistance Coordinators in K-12 schools. 
 
 
 The  School Counselor (Post-Master’s Certification)  program meets the highest professional standards according to the New Jersey Department of Education and the national accrediting body, CACREP. This certification will provide the additional credit hours necessary to obtain a NJ School Counselor Certification.   
 
 
 The  Advanced Counseling Certificate  program is designed to fulfill state-level and national standards for Licensed Professional Counselors. This program meets the highest professional standards according to CACREP, The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC), and the NJ Board of Marriage and Family Therapists.

title: Picnic Paint and Sip
location: The Student Center Quad/Ballroom C (Rain Location)
description: Unwind from finals with the Office of Student Belonging for a Picnic Paint and Sip! Enjoy a relaxing day outdoors with friends. All students are welcome!

title: Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions - One day, Three Locations
location: Student Center Quad 1, School of Communication Lobby Staircase, & Memorial Auditorium Courtyard
description:
🎨✨ You’re invited to the Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions! 
   
 Presented by the Department of Art & Design, this one-day, three-location event features powerful work from students in collaboration with Professors Jess Blaustein, Simone Couto, and Genevieve Lowe. 
   
 🗓️  Tuesday, April 29, 2025 🕑  2:00–4:00 PM 📍  Three unique exhibitions across campus 
   
 🔻  SECTION 01: Awakening Visions 📍  Student Center Quad 1 Exploring identity, gender, desire, suffering, and transcendence through deeply personal and collective perspectives. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 02: Elevate 📍  School of Communication Lobby Staircase A reflection on growth, experimentation, and the evolving practice of becoming—artistically and individually. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 03: Labyrinths of Matter 📍  Memorial Auditorium Courtyard An immersive journey through materiality, emotion, and meaning—get lost and discover something within. 
   
 Come walk the campus, meet the artists, and experience a vibrant range of voices, visions, and mediums. 🎭🖼️🌀

 Student Affairs/Higher Education

title: MS Analytics & Graduate Certificate Virtual Information Session
description:
Montclair's  MS in Business Analytics  equips students with the skills to analyze complex data, solve business challenges, and drive decision-making across industries like finance, healthcare, marketing, and technology. Whether you're looking to advance in your current role or pivot into analytics, this is your opportunity to gain a competitive edge. 
 Join us for a virtual information session April 29 at 9:30 AM (EST)  to learn how our program prepares graduates to tackle complex business challenges and lead data-driven initiatives at globally recognized companies.

title: CPT Workshop - International Students (F-1 Visa Holders) Only
description: For students who are planning to apply for CPT for the summer or fall 2025 semesters. Learn more about Curricular Practical Training (CPT) for F-1 students. Any student planning to apply for CPT is REQUIRED to attend a workshop before they can apply. This workshop is for CURRENT students ONLY - any other attendees will be removed.

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

description: Weekly meeting for Greek Council, that governs of the Greek Letter organizations, and is an entity of the Office of Greek Life and Montclair State University.

title: MS Analytics & Graduate Certificate Virtual Information Session
description:
Montclair's  MS in Business Analytics  equips students with the skills to analyze complex data, solve business challenges, and drive decision-making across industries like finance, healthcare, marketing, and technology. Whether you're looking to advance in your current role or pivot into analytics, this is your opportunity to gain a competitive edge. 
 Join us for a virtual information session April 29 at 9:30 AM (EST)  to learn how our program prepares graduates to tackle complex business challenges and lead data-driven initiatives at globally recognized companies.

title: Annotated Bibliographies
description:
Learn about the different types of annotated bibliographies, what information is included in each type, and how to format your annotated bibliography. 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Citing Sources by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14374621

title: CPT Workshop - International Students (F-1 Visa Holders) Only
description: For students who are planning to apply for CPT for the summer or fall 2025 semesters. Learn more about Curricular Practical Training (CPT) for F-1 students. Any student planning to apply for CPT is REQUIRED to attend a workshop before they can apply. This workshop is for CURRENT students ONLY - any other attendees will be removed.

title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brenda Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: Graduate Counseling Certificates Virtual Information Session
description:
Looking to expand your expertise and open new career opportunities in counseling? Our career-focused certificate programs can help you grow professionally and make a greater impact in the field of mental health and wellness.  Our academic preparation follows guidelines established by state licensure and certification boards, ensuring you have the most up-to-date training to perform on the job. During our  upcoming virtual information session on April 29 at 12:30 PM , you will learn about the following certificates we offer: 
 
 
 
   
 
 
 The courses in the  Certified Alcohol and Drug Counselor (CADC) Certificate  program fulfill the educational requirements set by the Addiction Professionals Certification Board of New Jersey (APCBNJ) for CADC eligibility.   
 
 
 The  Student Assistance Coordinator  program offers students the opportunity to take a sequence of post-master’s courses required by the New Jersey Department of Education for individuals who wish to become Student Assistance Coordinators in K-12 schools. 
 
 
 The  School Counselor (Post-Master’s Certification)  program meets the highest professional standards according to the New Jersey Department of Education and the national accrediting body, CACREP. This certification will provide the additional credit hours necessary to obtain a NJ School Counselor Certification.   
 
 
 The  Advanced Counseling Certificate  program is designed to fulfill state-level and national standards for Licensed Professional Counselors. This program meets the highest professional standards according to CACREP, The National Board for Certified Counselors (NBCC), and the NJ Board of Marriage and Family Therapists.

title: Picnic Paint and Sip
location: The Student Center Quad/Ballroom C (Rain Location)
description: Unwind from finals with the Office of Student Belonging for a Picnic Paint and Sip! Enjoy a relaxing day outdoors with friends. All students are welcome!

title: Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions - One day, Three Locations
location: Student Center Quad 1, School of Communication Lobby Staircase, & Memorial Auditorium Courtyard
description:
🎨✨ You’re invited to the Integrative Studio II Student-led Exhibitions! 
   
 Presented by the Department of Art & Design, this one-day, three-location event features powerful work from students in collaboration with Professors Jess Blaustein, Simone Couto, and Genevieve Lowe. 
   
 🗓️  Tuesday, April 29, 2025 🕑  2:00–4:00 PM 📍  Three unique exhibitions across campus 
   
 🔻  SECTION 01: Awakening Visions 📍  Student Center Quad 1 Exploring identity, gender, desire, suffering, and transcendence through deeply personal and collective perspectives. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 02: Elevate 📍  School of Communication Lobby Staircase A reflection on growth, experimentation, and the evolving practice of becoming—artistically and individually. 
   
 🔻  SECTION 03: Labyrinths of Matter 📍  Memorial Auditorium Courtyard An immersive journey through materiality, emotion, and meaning—get lost and discover something within. 
   
 Come walk the campus, meet the artists, and experience a vibrant range of voices, visions, and mediums. 🎭🖼️🌀

title: Counseling MA Virtual Information Session (School Counseling & Student Affairs/Higher Education Concentrations)
description:
Prepare for roles where you can help students navigate challenges, grow, and succeed. Whether you're interested in guiding K-12 students as a school counselor or supporting college students in higher education, our Counseling programs offer the training and credentials to build a meaningful career. Join us for a virtual information session on April 29 at 4:00 PM (EST) . Our programs are designed to provide you with the knowledge, skills, and practical experience you need to become a successful counselor. This session will cover the following concentrations: 
 
 School Counseling 
 Student Affairs/Higher Education
